alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Howard; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 4:30AM CDT until July 29 at 5:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Greeley County in central Nebraska... Valley County in central Nebraska... Sherman County in central Nebraska... Northwestern Howard County in central Nebraska... * Until 515 AM CDT. * At 428 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles northeast of Fort Hartsuff State Park to near Ord to near Weissert, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Automated Weather Station reported wind gusts near 60 mph. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Ord around 435 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Arcadia, North Loup, Scotia, Loup City, Cotesfield, Greeley, Spalding and Elba. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on Sherman Lake or camping nearby, get away from the water and move indoors. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now as damaging wind gusts are expected with this storm. Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
